attributes.action: Award Jimmy Hill A Posthumorous Knighthood for "Services to Football".
attributes.additional_details: +, He Pioneered: Scoring 5 Away-Goals in A Football Match (Doncaster Rovers 1 v 6 Fulham – 15 March 1958); "Thriller" Football Matches (FA Cup Semi-Final Replay @ Highbury on 26 March 1958: Fulham 3 v 5 Manchester United (7 Weeks After the "Munich Air Disaster" - How We Reminisced/Joshed about This Fantastic Match, In Which He Scored & Also In Every Previous Round), + "He Was A Linesman for the County" (Actually: Arsenal v Liverpool (16 September 1972)); "Football Punditry".
attributes.background: ENGLISH FOOTBALL'S GREATEST INNOVATOR !!!!! His Achievements Are Too Numerous to Detail Here, So, Please Read His Wikipedia Entry. Jimmy Was Generous with His Time & Humour - I Met Him + I Had Several Telecons with Him & Exchanges of Letters about the "Management of Football/England".

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for someone to be nominated for an honour. You don't need a petition through this site to do that: members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
